title: Launch Roundup: Vulcan ready for second flight; Hera mission set to study asteroid
summary: The United Launch Alliance (ULA) is preparing for the second flight of its Vulcan Centaur rocket this week. The mission will see Vulcan carry an inert payload to orbit alongside some experiments and demonstrations and will complete its certification process with the U.S. Space Force (USSF).

title: ULA rolls its Vulcan rocket to the launch pad ahead of second test flight
summary: The return of a Vulcan rocket to the pad at Space Launch Complex 41 comes as United Launch Alliance steps closer to being able to launch national security missions for the U.S. Space Force and the National Reconnaissance Office. Launch is set for Friday, Oct. 4, during a three-hour launch window that opens at 6 a.m. EDT (1000 UTC).

title: United Launch Alliance prepares for crucial certification flight as U.S. Space Force watches closely
summary: Brig. Gen. Panzenhagen: Following Vulcan’ Cert-2 mission, “We will need some time to make sure that everything was clean”

title: Rocket Report: ABL loses its second booster; Falcon 9 cleared for return to flight
Vulcan Centaur’s Cert-2 Mission to Launch Inert Payload, Sierra Space Dream Chaser Demo Delayed

title: ULA Provides Update on Cert-2 Mission
summary: On Wednesday, June 26 2024, in a media roundtable hosted by United Launch Alliance, company President and CEO Tory Bruno laid out the path for Vulcan Centaur’s second flight, Cert-2.

title: Investing in Space: Why ULA needs to launch its second Vulcan rocket as soon as possible
summary: It’s easy to lose the forest for the trees when reporting on the day-to-day of the space industry. I often find myself needing to step back and walk through why an event or announcement matters, because often what a space company or agency thinks has obvious importance doesn’t immediately resonate with CNBC’s audience.
